results.title: Flowers in daily life
results.brief_description: Introduces the traditional Japanese art of flower arrangement including its historical and spiritual aspects. Shows the viewer a step-by-step guide to the daily art of flower arrangement.

results.title: Fire safety
results.brief_description: Comedian Ross Williams gives a light hearted, but informative overview of what to do in different sorts of fires such as; kitchen fires, car fires, house fires, bush fires, and campfires. The programme also looks at effective use of appropriate fire extinguishers, the importance of smoke detectors and evacuataion plans, and general safety with household items. Produced with the assistance of Avalon Airport Rescue and Fire Fighting Services, NSW Mines Rescue Service and Tasmanian Fire Service.

results.title: Finding the way home
results.creator_credit: Julie McDonald and Children's Welfare Association of Victoria
results.brief_description: Foster parents in rural Victoria discuss what it’s like to care for a foster child, covering issues such as selecting a child, financial implications, emotional support, and most importantly, the benefits. Families interviewed include a single mother with children, an older childless couple, and a middle aged couple with their own children. A young man whose lived with a foster family also shares his experience. Worthwhile viewing for anyone considering fostering a child. Supported by the Federal Department of Family and Community Services.

results.title: Finding good ideas for stories: 3 magical methods
results.brief_description:
A comedic look at the three main methods of writing fairy stories or fantasies:
1. Picture an object and add something to it.
2. Picture an object…what might happen if you give it life.
3. Picture an object…what might happen if you make it bigger or smaller.

results.title: Find the one that's different
results.creator_credit: Bill Wadsmith and University of Wisconsin
results.brief_description: Designed to help teachers identify and work effectively with students who have learning disabilities. Provides examples of the frustration and failure of children whose problems are not recognised, as well as the remarkable success of children whose behavioural patterns are diagnosed as a learning disability and are dealt with appropriately. Suitable for teachers and tertiary level.

results.title: Film workshop
results.creator_credit: J Parsons and J B Parsons and Associates
results.brief_description: This film shows the production of two short films by third-year boys at Cornwell Secondary Modern School, East Hampshire. At this school a complete four year syllabus was devised so thet every boy received at least an hour’s screen education each week.

results.title: Fifteenth Olympic Games - Helsinki: Men's diving
results.brief_description: Made with the official sanction of FINA, this film records the following diving events at the Helsinki Olympic Games: -Workouts on tower and springboard; final three-meter springboard- men; final platform- men; final platform diving- women.
